name: River Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I will start with the positives first. The location was awesome and was one of the prettiest areas of downtown. There was so much to do so close by. The price was exceptional for that area (averaged $199 per night), we stayed a sat and Sunday night. The room was clean and the shower was a walk-in with tile. We had a view of the river which was nice and could see the boats going by. The restaurant, Bella Bacinos was located in the hotel and had a great vibe. The drinks were pricey but it was expected considering where we were. We only had breakfast to go but it was good and priced ok. ($15 for breakfast sandwich (called panini but really was a mcmuffin) and 2 eggs bacon and hash browns with cheese). The food was fresh and hot. The staff was excellent and had a very welcoming attitude. We asked for wine bottle opener, beer bottle opener and a knife to cut a lime and they brought it to the room. The free fresh bottled water at every elevator was so convenient and refreshing. Thermostat was next to the bed and it was cold so we were able to turn the heat on before getting out of bed. Now the negatives....the room was the smallest I have ever stayed in and the bed was a concrete block with a sheet over it. Unfortunately, that is why I have to give this hotel an average rating. When we travel we are hardly in our room much but when we are we are exhausted and need a good night’s rest. The lights from downtown poured in the room in spite of the blackout curtains, the bed was hard as a rock (tossed and turned, had to get out of bed before I wanted to cause my back was hurting so bad) and the we could hear a very interesting argument the neighbors were having outside their room and it felt like they were in the room with us plus the sirens every couple of hours reminded us that we were in the heart of downtown. If you can sleep on anything and through anything then this is the perfect hotel
reviews.title: Quaint.....but not my favorite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes the room was small but it was very clean, which I appreciate more than a larger room. The hotel is designed for businessmen, but as a couple we were perfectly happy. Interesting amenities: Ipod docking station next to the bed, refillable water bottle stations throughout the hotel.
reviews.title: small room but great experience

reviews.text: I was shocked by the size of their standard room , and their queen bed is like full size . Don't bother argue with them no one listen . The only thing they have is location .
reviews.title: Expensive for what it's offer

reviews.text: I arrived early AM and was given a room immediately. It was small, but clean and attractive in a generic way. This is not a complaint, just fact. It would have been small for two, but perfect for one. There was no view unfortunately. Next time, and there will be a next time, I will ask for a river view which one of my traveling companions had and it was spacious enough for a small group to meet in. There was no noise, it was silent every evening. The bedding was fresh, pillows were good and staff was helpful. Location was good. Thoroughly enjoyed my stay.
reviews.title: Really liked this hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were on the fifth floor in a corner unit. At first we loved the location of the hotel and really liked the room. Then we looked out the window. Nothing but alley, dumpster and at night very loud. The tv was extremely small and so far from the bed it was hard to see and hear. The rooms was decorated from IKEA. Then getting in the shower in the morning. Wow!!!! I have been in some small showers in Europe but this was definitly the tightest. I am 5'9" 160 and it was a difficult shower. On the second night a group of guys came rolling in about 4 am banging doors and very loud. It continued until 8:30 when they finally checked out. I called the front desk twice. I am not sure they did anything the first time. The mattress was old, flat and extremely firm. Pillows were old and used. Too many other hotel chains are upgrading the bedding. The point here is that you will not get a good nights sleep. The little bit of money we saved staying here was not worth it. There are plenty of other hotels close by.
reviews.title: We didnt have any of the good things we read about

reviews.text: Rooms arent the biggest of size, however they are very neat and easily do the job. Best thing that I found about this hotel is the location is very central, it is an easy walk to transport or to the main part of the city. Staff were friendly. Bit on the expensive side of things for what you get, but I suppose the location makes up for most of that. I would stay here again if I went back to chicago
reviews.title: Nice place to stay, very happy with the location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were pleased with this hotel. It is in a great location as you can easily walk most places on either side of the river. We booked this hotel primarily because the parking was cheap compared with other hotels. The parking garage is secure and only a block away from the hotel.
reviews.title: Good value, cheap parking

reviews.text: The room was clean and looked like it had recently been refurbished. As noted in other reviews the rooms are on the small side but for the price and being located downtown in a big city that's to be expected. If you want a bigger room then you'll have to fork out more, but for my husband and I it was fine.
reviews.title: Perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Perhaps given the time of year the hotel wasn't very full but we were very happy that we didn't experience noise from either the other rooms or the street.
reviews.title: Gem of a place

reviews.text: Across the street/river from Trump Tower, close to Millenium Park, Magnificent Mile, Willis Tower, John Hancock Observatory and downtown shopping. We also walked to Shedd Aquarium and Navy Pier. The United Centre (hockey/basketball) was 6 miles so it was a short cab ride.
reviews.title: Loved it!!!

reviews.text: I had a meeting in Chicago that started at 11:30 on Friday April 13, 2012. I left New York on a 7:10 AM flight so I could arrive in Chicago early enough to check into my room and freshen up. I arrived at the River Hotel at 10:00 AM and ask to check in early. I was told that a room was available but would have to pay a $35 early check in fee. I have never been charged an early check in fee at any hotel I have stayed in in my life and beleive this is insulting for a guest with a firm prepaid reservation. I did not pay the early check in fee and went to the Rennasance hotel bathroom to brush my teeth and wash my face.
reviews.title: Early checkin fee

reviews.text: Since I know this is your policy/practice I will not stay at your facility again and share my experience with others.
reviews.title: Great location, lovely hotel

reviews.text: This is a great hotel in a fab location for exploring the sites and doing some shopping. I arrived at the hotel after three weeks of travelling around the States and staying in hostels and was delighted with how lovely my room was.
reviews.title: LOVE THIS HOTEL!! CONVENIENT TO DOWNTOWN SHOPPING AND GREAT VIEWS

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was travelling on my own at this stage and found the hotel staff very nice. On my last day they looked after my luggage while I did some last minute shopping before heading for the airport. The price was really reasonable to so I would highly recommend this hotel to people visiting Chicago. I stayed last October; review is way over due!
reviews.title: Great Value and even better location!!

reviews.text: A friend of mine and I stayed at the River Hotel on Wacker Drive on Friday February 24, 2012. We wanted to be close to Michigan St shopping, and we weren't disappointed. The hotel is within a block of Michigan St shopping, right across the street from the River, which made for a beautiful view from our 10th floor room at night. They have valet parking, which is cheap compared to most Chicago parking. They charge $35 for valet parking for $24 hours. I've seen parking in Chicago much higher.
reviews.title: Very good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had booked a standard room at Club Quarters Wacker which we found is located in the River Hotel. We were offered an upgrade to a Junior Suite for just $20 per night so checked out both rooms. The standard, although nicely appointed, was so small there was literally NO place to even put a suitcase and looked out directly at a brick wall. The Jr. Suite was amazing with lots of room, a sofa, desk, refrigerator, microwave and couple of chairs and had an impressive view of the river and the city. Well worth the extra $20 per night!
reviews.title: River Hotel=Club Quarters Wacker

reviews.text: A comfortable bed, soft, abundant pillows and a good shower are high on my list of what makes a great stay and I'm happy to say they all scored high points from me. The location was prime, just steps from Million Dollar mile and also the theater district. There are an abundance of restaurants, both expensive and budget right in the neighborhood. We ordered pizza at Baccino's at the hotel and were really disappointed but the pasta looked great and the service was good.
reviews.title: The River in Chicago, on the river, was a great experience!

reviews.text: One just slightly annoying thing about the hotel is that it requires using your room key to access your floor in the elevator. This can be difficult sometimes if your hands are full and it can be very temperamental if you don't insert your card just so. However all the good things, like complimentary filtered water dispenser with bottles, Kuerig coffee machines and an office area with free use of printer certainly out weigh the little irritations.
reviews.title: Excellent choice

reviews.text: We consider this hotel a real unknown gem and will definately stay here again.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but the housekeeping sucks

reviews.text: The River Hotel at 73 E. Wacker is a gem. Great location. Very pleasant and helpful staff. The room was not large but very sufficient, clean, and modern. Would recommend and stay there again.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel

description: Private, full service hotel with 121 rooms located on the Chicago river. Just one block north of River Hotel is the magnificent mile, famous for shopping. The hotel is a convenient walk to the Chicago Cultural Center, Grant Park, and Marina City. River Hotel is the best value hotel based on quality and the prime location. River Hotel provides:• Safe, restricted entry• Instant registration and check out• Free high speed internet access throughout the hotel• Onsite restaurant • Multi-menu in room dining options (through onsite restaurant and many local restaurants)• Refrigerator and microwave available• Unlimited complimentary chilled purified bottled water • 6 meeting and event rooms available (maximum reception style 120 people)• Free use of computer/printer • Ergonomic workstations• State of the art guest rooms with premium bedding• Contemporary furnishings• Flat panel HD TVs• Complimentary coffee and tea• 24 hour guest service desk • Fitness room • Exercise equipment delivered to guest room upon request • Corporate Apartments available • Value rates.
